channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description:
This afternoon. https://t.co/pHo566XHA2

Due to a hilarious mixup where I lost my digital ticket (I know), it turned out a member of the club was giving away her extra free ticket, so I have a physical keepsake of it. https://t.co/JCL6ljTuCG

item.description:
TIL that the Toronto Star‚Äôs style guide prefers ‚Äúshirzee‚Äù over ‚Äúshirsey‚Äù (my preferred spelling) for a sports team t-shirt with a player‚Äôs name and number on the back. https://t.co/LuFqPmOUKJ

(He says, wearing his beloved Seattle Mariners Ichiro #51 shirsey he bought on sale after he was traded to the Yankees.)

item.description:
The first Friday after Labour Day is the best Friday.

The back-to-school period can be a little overwhelming for people who wanted to be parents, though.

item.description: @BombasticDave @dlbno Of course. I also have no knowledge of or plans to, nor a desire to, implement a single misfortune, much less 6 misfortunes. All I‚Äôm stating are the odds of them happening, no more, no less.
item.source:markdown: @BombasticDave @dlbno Of course. I also have no knowledge of or plans to, nor a desire to, implement a single misfortune, much less 6 misfortunes. All I‚Äôm stating are the odds of them happening, no more, no less.

item.description: @dlbno For that to happen, the Royal Family would have to fall victim to 6 separate misfortunes and would be unable to reign. But that will never happen. 3 misfortunes? That‚Äôs possible. 5 misfortunes? There‚Äôs an outside chance. But 6 misfortunes? I‚Äôd like to see that.
item.source:markdown: @dlbno For that to happen, the Royal Family would have to fall victim to 6 separate misfortunes and would be unable to reign. But that will never happen. 3 misfortunes? That‚Äôs possible. 5 misfortunes? There‚Äôs an outside chance. But 6 misfortunes? I‚Äôd like to see that.

item.description:
The second part of the UK TV series House of Cards imagines a strained relationship between the prime minister and an activist King (a very thinly veiled version of then-Prince Charles) after the Queen dies. https://t.co/lwZjEcB1D1

You might very well think that House of Cards (UK) is better than the American version of the show, but I couldn‚Äôt possibly comment.
item.source:markdown:
The second part of the UK TV series House of Cards imagines a strained relationship between the prime minister and an activist King (a very thinly veiled version of then-Prince Charles) after the Queen dies. https://t.co/lwZjEcB1D1
You might very well think that House of Cards (UK) is better than the American version of the show, but I couldn‚Äôt possibly comment.

item.description:
I went to bed last night angry and sad about how unfair it was that I didn‚Äôt get to see my mother for over a year and a half before she died, but glad at all the time I had to talk with her up until the end.

Anyway, if you need me to be angry and sad about something, it‚Äôll have to compete with that.
item.source:markdown:

Anyway, if you need me to be angry and sad about something, it‚Äôll have to compete with that.

item.description:
@BovyMaltz It‚Äôs true, you never do actually see Her Majesty in Yes Minister/Yes, Prime Minister.

item.description: If you need to get something off your chest without anybody noticing, the next couple of days might be a good time to do it, especially if you live in a Commonwealth realm.
item.source:markdown: If you need to get something off your chest without anybody noticing, the next couple of days might be a good time to do it, especially if you live in a Commonwealth realm.

item.description:
Overhearing a conversation where a guy introduced himself to a woman, he says he likes her shirt, and they‚Äôre talking about the concert she‚Äôs going to. Now he‚Äôs deciding whether he should go to the concert now. That‚Äôs how it happens, I guess.

They‚Äôre still talking about music and TV shows, and they haven‚Äôt gotten to the ‚Äúvalues conversation‚Äù yet, so I can‚Äôt tell how their relationship will progress beyond sharing what popular culture they enjoy.
item.source:markdown:
Overhearing a conversation where a guy introduced himself to a woman, he says he likes her shirt, and they‚Äôre talking about the concert she‚Äôs going to. Now he‚Äôs deciding whether he should go to the concert now. That‚Äôs how it happens, I guess.
They‚Äôre still talking about music and TV shows, and they haven‚Äôt gotten to the ‚Äúvalues conversation‚Äù yet, so I can‚Äôt tell how their relationship will progress beyond sharing what popular culture they enjoy.
